ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I developed a deep understanding of my thesis topic by reading loads of sources.
I improved my independent research skills and, with the help of my advisor, learned to craft an intervention that was both longer and more deeply felt than any paper I had previously written.

I learned so much from working on my thesis with Prof Deming. We read some philosophical novels in the first semester that were really helpful as role models for my writing. In the second semester, we focused on my writing. I learned a lot about how to write philosophical prose, and how to balance concrete vs abstract writing. I learned some tricks for writing dialogue as well.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I loved the freedom I had to do this thesis my way. I could work at my own pace, and pursue areas of particular interest at will.

In my experience, the Humanities senior essay requires more academic independence than the vast majority of other classes. I think that's a strength, especially if those taking the class are planning to pursue similar endeavors in the future.

Overall the mostly independent guidelines for planning and writing the thesis worked for me, but it would have been nice to have more consistent communication from the DUS about deadlines. Over the course of the semester a few of the deadlines indicated on the official guidelines sheet ended up changing, which led to some confusing last-minute issues.
I loved working with Prof Deming! No weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It was pretty great. All virtual, all reading and videos and source material. Could not really be improved format-wise.
My advisor was very helpful in sending me online resources (like databases on very specific topics) that I couldn't easily find physically due to COVID restrictions.
One on one zoom with Prof Deming worked well during Covd-19.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Writing a senior essay is an incredibly challenging but enjoyable task.

Yes. The freedom to choose a specialized course of study the Humanities major offers is reproduced in the Senior Essay, and that freedom of topic allowed me to write an essay that I felt helped me understand my own philosophy of the world.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: I learned by reading on my own and having monthly virtual meetings with my advisor.
Independently organized sessions with thesis advisor and Humanities DUS
